intro: Impatiens masisiensis, commonly known as the Masisi Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the genus Impatiens, which is part of the family Balsaminaceae, known for its diverse and colorful species. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often climbing. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
